boat.name: Plugger
boat.full_description:
'Plugger' was originally gunter rigged with Bermudan mizzen (sails in use 2008 were from a Plymouth sailmaker of the 1960s), then converted to gaff sloop rig of main with topsail and with a roach batterned mizzen all by RS Hanniford of Cleveland 2009.

She was probably originally a Navy pattern hull from the 1920s, although there was no name plate or markings found during restoration.

At an early stage the boat was fitted with a centrifugal clutch Stuart Turner inboard 4HP petrol engine. The motor converted by Stuart Turner with sailing gearbox, originally built before 1938. We know this as Stuart Turner have records for the engine being modified in 1953, when a reverse gearbox was fitted during a refit at Mashford's Yard, Crymll.

The engine was restored to working order in 2009 during her restoration to sailing condition. 'Plugger' was redecked in July 2015.
boat.short_description: 'Plugger' is a 17' 6" quarter decked clinker mahogany on oak dayboat from the 1920s.

for_sales.sales_text: "Plugger" is a 1920s 17" 6' quarter decked clinker, mahogany on oak dayboat. Clinker gaff rigged sloop ketch, Stuart Turner P5m inboard (non runner). New sails (2009), full inventory. Good, braked road trailer included.
